title: My Culture Project
description:
Celebrate cultural diversity in your classroom while supporting your students to develop their communication skills, understanding of others and appreciation for cultures around the world through 'My Culture Project'. This printable culture project for kids contains space for your students to share their country, flag, languages, favourite traditional foods, a description of a special occasion they celebrate with their family, traditional outfits and other interesting facts about their culture. This multicultural classroom activity is a 5 page booklet which can then be used for an oral presentation and/or classroom display exploring and celebrating the diversity within your class community. The resource also includes 4 printable worksheets for exploring class cultures further, and a display suggestion with accompanying template and banner lettering. Use this culture project as a heritage month activity, back to school activity, cultural awareness week activity or as part of your Ethical Education Curriculum (e.g. 'Learn Together' or 'GMGY')

Your students could complete the world cultures booklet in school or as a family project at home. The children could then share their booklets with each other in pairs, groups or as a presentation for the class. This would provide a fantastic opportunity to talk about cultural diversity within the class. These booklets could also be added to your classroom library so the children can learn more about each other throughout the year. You could use these templates as a stand alone project or as part of a Conceptual Enquiry based on culture and traditions.

Includes UK and US spellings (favourite/favorite).

If you would like to see some of the other resources that I love using with my students, check out my instagram account at @ciarasclassroom.

Also, I would really appreciate it if you could leave a review for this product on my store. Your feedback will help me to continue to make helpful resources for you and your students.Â You can also earn TpT credit to use towards future purchases on this website!

description:

These Student Council Certificates are a perfect way to celebrate the dedication and hard work of your student leaders. With multiple color options and a printer-friendly black and white version, these certificates are a versatile and customizable option for any school or classroom.

title: Student Council Resource Bundle for Elementary School Leadership Programs
description:
Are you interested in setting up a Student Council or Student Government but have no idea where to start? This Student Council bundle is the perfect one-stop-shop for all your Student Council needs, and will help you with all stages of setting up, facilitating and supporting your elementary school Student Council, from before the elections all the way to the end-of-year school assembly.

Empower your students to make a difference, foster leadership skills, and create a positive impact on your school community with these student leadership resources. Get started today and unlock the full potential of your Student Council or Student Government!

This Student Council Bundle includes:

  • Student Council Information PowerPoint - This PowerPoint is designed to be used ahead of setting up the new Student Council. It includes editable slides on topics such as what a Student Council is, the elections process, the characteristics of a good leader etc.

  • Announcement Posters for Student Council Elections - These posters can be hung all around your school building and/or campus to let students know when the Student Council elections will take place. The clipart used reflects the diversity of the school community.

  • Student Council Nomination Forms - These forms can be printed and photocopied for any student nominations. The forms are clear and concise, and encourage the students to consider why they would be a good candidate and why they are interested in the role.

  • Student Council News Banner - This banner is ideal for your Student Council's noticeboard/bulletin board. This will help your Student Council to share updates with the student body and helps to support student voice in your school.

  • Student Council Bulletin Board Headings - These headings will help to organise the Student Council's noticeboard/bulletin board. The headings include 'Meet our Student Council', 'What We Are Working On', 'Our Student Council Vision', 'Important Updates', 'Children's Rights' and 'Student Voice'.

  • Student Council Certificates - Congratulate and thank your Student Council members at the end of their term as class reps with these certificates. These could be presented to students at the final school assembly of the school year.

  • Student Council Newsletter Templates - Use these newsletter templates to enable your Student Council members to quickly create weekly, monthly or termly school newsletters.

  • Student Council Charter - This Word Document is fully editable and will help you to create your perfect Student Council Charter to help guide and support your Student Council.

  • Student Council Folder/Binder - This resource pack includes everything you need to set up the Student Council Binder for the year. There are two covers to choose from ('Student Council Binder' and 'Student Council Folder') and a variety of templates.
    Templates include:
    • Planning the Student Council Elections
    • This Year's Student Council Members
    • Student Council Vision for _____
    • Student Council Ideas/Brainstorm
    • This Year's Student Council (bullet points)
    • Student Council Goals
    • Student Council Goal Setting ( using SMART to set clear attainable goals)
    • Checklist for Current Student Council Goal
    • Meeting Agenda
    • Meeting Minutes (broken into 'Discussion Points', 'Action Items' and 'Next Meeting')
    • Student Council To Do List
    • Student Council Notes Sheet
    • Student Council Calendar (month by month)

PERFECT FOR:

  • New Student Council Advisors
  • Elementary Student Government Programs
  • School Leadership Coordinators
  • Student Voice Initiatives
  • Back-to-School Student Elections

BONUS: Free access to all future Student Council resources added to this bundle!

Other resources you may be interested in:

  • Inclusive Classroom Posters for Celebrating Diversity
  • Circle Time Conversation Cards for Multicultural Classrooms
  • Everyone is Welcome Door Display

title: Conversation Starter Question Cards for Inclusive Multicultural Morning Meetings
description:
These multicultural conversation cards provide elementary teachers with 50 thoughtfully designed discussion starters perfect for morning meetings, circle time, and classroom community building. Ideal for grades 2-6, these diversity discussion cards help students develop cultural awareness, empathy, and respectful communication skills while building an inclusive classroom environment. Teachers can use these conversation starters for morning meeting questions, social emotional learning activities, cultural diversity discussions, and writing prompts throughout the school year. This versatile teaching resource is perfect for elementary classroom teachers looking t facilitate meaningful conversations that foster empathy and respect for all.

Some examples of prompts included in this set are:

  • Share one thing that makes your family special.
  • How would you change the world if you could?
  • How can we make sure that everyone in our class/school feel valued and included?
  • Tell us about your favourite holiday or celebration that you and your family enjoy.
  • What thing about yourself are you most proud of?

In addition to the 50 question cards, this product also includes six blank cards for you to create your own prompts.

These conversation starter cards are ideal for teachers looking for multicultural classroom resources, respectful conversation skills, and oral language skill development. They can also be used for ethical education and Learn Together lessons in Educate Together schools. Add this resource to your teaching toolkit and help your students become more inclusive, empathetic, and respectful global citizens.

I would love to see how you use these conversation cards in your classroom. If you would like to share some pictures with me and see some of the other activities I use in my classroom, check out my Instagram page at @ciarasclassroom.

title: Children's Rights UN Convention Display Pack
description:
Empower your students with a vibrant Children's Rights UN Convention Display Pack! This children's rights resource includes a 32-piece display that focuses on the UN Convention on the Rights of the Child (UNCRC), providing an engaging way for students to learn about their rights and express their understanding creatively.

Resource Highlights:

  • Collaborative Learning: Each piece features a large hexagon that outlines a specific children's right from the UNCRC, alongside space for students to illustrate their interpretations. This activity promotes teamwork and encourages discussion about the importance of children's rights.
  • Flexible Display Options: Cut out the hexagons and arrange them in any pattern that suits your classroom space. This makes it easy to create a dynamic bulletin board that can be displayed year-round.
  • Promotes Ownership: By engaging in this creative process, students develop a sense of ownership and empowerment regarding their rights, fostering respect and awareness in the classroom.

Key Features:

  • Educational Focus: Aligned with the UNCRC, this resource is perfect for teaching social studies, citizenship, or multicultural education.
  • Visual Appeal: Create a striking display that makes a powerful statement about children's rights and inclusivity in your classroom.
  • Year-Round Use: Ideal for any time of year, this resource helps to keep the conversation about children's rights ongoing.

Download this Children's Rights UN Convention Display Pack today and transform your classroom into a space that celebrates and promotes the rights of every child!

title: Menorah Cut and Paste Hanukkah Craft - Chanukah Fine Motor Skills Activity
description:
Engage young learners in celebrating Hanukkah with this Menorah Cut and Paste Craft! Designed to develop fine motor skills and cutting skills, this hands-on activity is perfect for young students learning about Jewish traditions. With both color and black-and-white options, this versatile Hanukkah menorah craft can be used in various classroom settings or at home for holiday fun.

What's Included:

  • Easy-to-use cut and paste menorah template in both color and black-and-white
  • Kid-friendly design for students in early elementary grades that encourages creativity and fine motor skill development
  • Perfect for bulletin boards, classroom displays, or as a take-home project

Why Teachers Love It: This menorah craft is a no-prep activity that seamlessly fits into Hanukkah lesson plans, Jewish studies, and fine motor skill sessions. Children will love assembling their own menorah by cutting out and pasting the candles, making this craft a memorable way to celebrate Hanukkah traditions. The resource is easy to use year after year, making it an excellent addition to your holiday collection.

Key Features:

  • Skill Focus: Fine motor development through cutting and gluing
  • Flexible Use: Ideal for classroom crafts, homework assignments, or home learning
  • Reusable: Download once and enjoy a fun Hanukkah activity for years

How to Use: Simply print, provide scissors and glue, and let your students create their menorah by arranging and pasting the candles. Perfect for adding a hands-on element to Hanukkah lessons and for creating an engaging classroom display!

title: Celebrating Cultures - My Culture Project and Flipbook BUNDLE
description:
Celebrate cultural diversity with our Celebrating Cultures resources bundle; perfect for teachers looking to create an inclusive, multicultural classroom. This resource pack combines two of my best selling resources - the My Culture Project and About My Culture Flipbook. This bundle supports students to learn more about cultures around the world and share their culture project with classmates.

The 'About My Culture Flipbook' offers a fun and interactive way for students to share about cultures. With a focus on research and writing skills, this flipbook will support your students in sharing and learning about their peer's cultures and develop a deeper understanding of cultural diversity.

'My Culture Project' offers an engaging and creative way for students to showcase their own culture or explore cultures from around the world. This project includes a project template, multiple graphic organizers, and a template for creating a display on the classroom bulletin board.

This bundled resource pack is perfect for teachers looking to create an inclusive and respectful classroom community. It provides students with a rich and immersive learning experience that promotes cultural sensitivity and appreciation. Ideal for class projects and learning about cultures, this pack is a valuable addition to any classroom. Buy now and take the first step towards creating an inclusive and welcoming classroom environment for all your students.

You could use these templates as a stand-alone project or as part of a Conceptual Enquiry based on culture and traditions.

title: My Family Celebration Project
description:
Explore family traditions and celebrations in your classroom with this engaging 'My Family Celebration' project! This 4-page booklet and accompanying graphic organizer worksheets are perfect for encouraging conversations about cultural diversity and identity among your students. The 'Family Celebration' project is ideal for social studies lessons about traditions and family celebrations, exploring cultures around the world and for promoting Ethical Education and Learn Together principles.

This project allows your students to choose a cultural celebration or special holiday from their family traditions and share it with their classmates. The open-ended nature of the project makes it a fun and inclusive activity for all students. It can be completed in school or as a family project at home, and the booklets can be shared with the class as a presentation or added to your classroom library for ongoing learning.

Incorporating UK and US spellings (favorite and favourite), this social studies resource is perfect for teaching heritage and identity. The resource includes three graphic organizer worksheets to facilitate conversations about similarities and differences between celebrations and traditions. This is an opportunity for your students to learn about each other's cultures and gain a better understanding of cultural diversity.

title: Identity Projects Bundle
description:
Explore cultural diversity and student identity with these five open-ended identity projects, ideal for fostering representation, multiculturalism, and student voice in the classroom. Perfect for teachers in Educate Together schools looking for resources for their Learn Together lessons, or for social studies teachers, this resource supports Heritage and Identity studies as well as cultural diversity discussions within class communities. Engaging and adaptable, each project empowers students to express their unique backgrounds, traditions, and celebrations. Ideal for social studies curriculum focusing on cultural diversity and inclusive representation, these projects make for meaningful, ready-to-go lessons that spark rich intercultural conversations.

This Identity Projects Bundle includes:

  • My Culture Project - This printable culture project contains space for your students to share their country, flag, languages, favourite traditional foods, a description of a special occasion they celebrate with their family, traditional outfits and other interesting facts about their culture. The culture project for kids is a 4 page booklet which can then be used for an oral presentation and/or classroom display exploring and celebrating the diversity within your class community. The resource also includes 4 printable worksheets for exploring class cultures further, and a display suggestion with accompanying template.

  • My Family Project - This project is a 4 page booklet which would be perfect for exploring family diversity, values, traditions and family structures within the classroom. The resource includes a project booklet, two drawing templates and two graphic organiser worksheets which could be used to facilitate conversations about similarities and differences between various types of families and what makes them special.

  • My Family Celebration Project - This project is a 4 page booklet which would be perfect for exploring family celebrations and traditions within the classroom. The resource includes both a project booklet and three graphic organiser worksheets which could be used to facilitate conversations about similarities and differences between the celebrations and traditions of your students and their families. The project is left completely open so that your students can each choose whatever cultural celebration or special holiday they would like to share.

  • My Special Symbol Project - This 'My Special Symbol' project is a 4 page booklet which would be perfect for exploring symbols (religious and non religious), values, traditions, backgrounds and cultures within the classroom. The resource includes a project booklet, three worksheets, a display creation template and an exploration sheet for introducing the idea of symbols, which could all be used to facilitate meaningful conversations about important symbols and what they mean to people.

  • Identity Iceberg - The identity iceberg is ideal for exploring identity, perception, diversity, prejudice and individuality with your students. This activities involves exploring visible and 'below the surface' identity markers. The identity worksheet is also a useful stimulus for class conversations about individuality, personality and identity.

If you would like to see some of the other resources that I love using with my students, check out my instagram account at @ciarasclassroom.

title: Children's Rights Activities Bundle
description:
Engage and empower your students with this Children's Rights Activities Bundle! Perfect for teaching about Children's Rights, social justice, and the UN Convention on the Rights of the Child (UNCRC), this comprehensive resource supports educators in fostering global citizenship and human rights awareness. Ideal for classrooms focused on inclusivity and multicultural education, this bundle includes interactive activities to help students understand their rights and responsibilities.

This Children's Rights Bundle includes:

  • Children's Rights Collaborative Display - This display pack includes a 32 piece display based on the UN Convention on the Rights of the Child. Each page features a large hexagon with a statement regarding a right identified in the UNCRC and space for the students to draw a picture. Once your students cut out their hexagon, create your display by joining up all the hexagons in whatever pattern works best for you and your available display space. This display is ideal all year round in any classroom!

  • Children's Rights Word Searches - Three wordsearches based on the topic of Children's Rights and the UN Convention on the Rights of the Child (also known as the UNCRC). Each word search comes in color and printer-friendly versions. This is a handy no-prep activity for your students to complete after learning about rights. There are three levels of the wordsearch included so you can easily differentiate for your students.

  • True or False Sorting Activity - This true or false sorting activity is perfect for sparking conversation and debate about rights and the UNCRC! Students work together to sort 28 statements under the headings 'true' and 'false'.

  • Children's Rights Poem - Looking for a poem for introducing or revising Children's Rights and the UN Convention on the Rights of the Child? This Children's Rights Poem is a handy print and go sheet with pictures for your students to color in at the bottom. The file includes 3 versions of the sheet with different images.

  • Flashcards - 28 flashcards for teaching key words relating to rights. They would also be helpful in creating a Children's Rights bulletin board.

  • KWL Charts - Ideal for eliciting prior knowledge, identifying questions and recording new learning.

  • Brainstorming Sheets

  • 2 Reading Comprehensions (two levels for you to choose from)

  • 9 worksheets for assessment and/or display

  • 2 styles of bunting for a class display

title: Elf Job Application - Christmas Writing Activity and Bulletin Board Lettering
description:
Transform your December writing activities with this engaging Christmas Elf Job Application pack, perfect for elementary classroom writing centers and festive bulletin board displays. This No PREP Christmas writing activity combines creative writing and holiday fun with your students writing their job application for a position as one of Santa's Elves, while also creating an eye-catching Christmas Bulletin Board with your class this December. Elementary teachers can use these Christmas creative writing templates for December writing stations, morning work, literacy centers, or early finisher activities while creating an eye-catching Christmas bulletin board display.

With a variety of options included, these templates will keep your students engaged and excited about writing during this Christmas season. Use one template with your whole class or promote student voice in the classroom by allowing your each of your students to choose which one they would like to work on. Write, color, cut out and hang the completed sheets on a December bulletin board to make a beautiful Christmas seasonal classroom display. We have also included two sets of Bulletin Board Lettering to help save you precious time and make your display as quick and easy as possible for you to put together! The two options included are 'Santa's Little Helpers!' and 'Santa's New Team!'

Resource includes:

  • Job application advert
  • Job application form (multiple differentiated versions included, as well as US and UK spellings)
  • Bulletin board lettering for creating a festive classroom display

If you would like to see some of the other resources that I love using with my students, check out my instagram account at @ciarasclassroom.

title: Templates for Researching World Religions
description:
Are you looking for simple yet engaging graphic organisers and worksheets to help your student in exploring, researching and learning about world religions? This bundle includes printables for researching (and organising) information about Christianity, Buddhism, Hinduism, Islam and Judaism. As well as exploring key information about each religion, your students will also have opportunities to compare and contrast the religions with each other, and in turn begin to see that we are all more alike than we are different. This resource pack would be ideal in multicultural and diverse classrooms in which the teacher wants to encourage open conversation and celebration of some of the many religions around the worldn, or teachers who are looking for a print and go resource for their World Religions Unit.

It's an engaging and entertaining collaborative project that encourages your students to work together to create a beautiful collaborative artwork as a class, which could be used as part of a festive bulletin board or classroom display.

title: Culture Interview and Culture Project Rubric
description:
This Culture Interview Project with Rubric is the perfect way to promote cultural awareness and celebrate cultural diversity in your classroom. It includes a set of 12 open-ended culture interview questions that students can use to interview a classmate (or other person) about their culture and heritage as part of a culture project. The questions are designed to encourage students to learn about different cultures from around the world and deeply reflect upon cultural backgrounds. Note-taking templates are also included for each question of the interview so your students can take note of important and interesting points and information discussed during the interview.

Following the interview, your students will complete a culture project based on their interviewee's culture. To assess the finalised poster projects, the pack also includes a rubric with assessment criteria based on content accuracy, creativity, organization, reflection, and presentation. This rubric will guide students on what is expected of their final product and will allow you to assess their understanding of different cultures accurately.

This Culture Interview and Culture Project pack is perfect for teachers who want to encourage cultural awareness and celebrate diversity in their classrooms. It is suitable for multicultural classrooms, social studies classes, or any other class that values cultural diversity.

If you would like to see some of the other resources that I love using with my students, check out my instagram account at @ciarasclassroom.

Also, I would really appreciate it if you could leave a review for this product on my store. Your feedback will help me to continue to make helpful resources for you and your students.Â You can also earn TpT credit to use towards future purchases on this website!

title: Ten Frame Classroom Management Reward Charts
description:
Looking for a fun and effective classroom management tool to support positive behavior in the classroom? Look no further than this versatile ten frame classroom management system!

Featuring three different versions of the ten frame template - "Our Ten Frame," "Our Class Ten Frame," and "My Ten Frame" - this reward system helps students develop their number sense and counting skills while working together as a team to achieve a common goal. Simply print, laminate, cut, and add magnets or Velcro dots to the tokens to create a reusable reward chart that can be customized to suit your class.

The behavior management system includes five general sets of tokens that can be used all year round, as well as 13 sets of seasonal tokens (Fall/Autumn leaves, snowmen, Santa, Christmas trees, Spring chicks, hot chocolate/cocoa, dreidels, Spring blossoms, shamrocks, sunshine, ice pops/popsicles and ice creams) to make it easy to adapt and keep things fresh, fun and engaging throughout the year. Plus, by choosing a reward to work towards as a class and letting students add tokens to the ten frame as they make positive choices, you can encourage a positive and supportive classroom culture that celebrates teamwork and individual growth.

So whether you're looking for a new classroom management tool, a way to reinforce math skills, or a fun way to celebrate successes and encourage positive behavior, this whole group classroom management system has everything you need to succeed!

If you would like to see some of the other resources that I love using with my students, check out my instagram account at @ciarasclassroom.

title: First Week of School Bundle
description:
Start the school year strong with this comprehensive First Week of School Activities Bundle! Perfect for back-to-school classroom setup, this 12-resource pack includes everything you need: engaging welcome displays, classroom management printables, organization templates, first-day art activities, motivational posters, and editable first and last day photo signs. Ideal for elementary teachers looking to create a warm, organized, and exciting environment for students from day one.

Included resources:

  • Inclusive Classroom Posters - These beautiful posters will be a perfect addition to your welcoming classroom. The posters feature images and phrases that celebrate diversity.

  • Multicultural Conversation Cards - Use these cards to facilitate open conversations in the classroom and help student to get to know each other on a deeper level. The questions are open ended and support respectful conversation skills.

  • Helpers of the Day Pack - This pack is a super easy-to-use classroom management tool that helps you keep track of 'helpers of the day'.

  • 'Everyone is Welcome' Display Pack - This is a fantastic collaborative art activity for the start of a new school year! It results in a welcoming door display that celebrates the unique identities within your class and/or school community.

  • 'I Wish My Teacher Knew' Notes - These notes are a perfect way to help build relationships with your students and open lines of communication for student who may want to share something important with you.

  • My Personal Best Worksheet - This worksheet is a great way to explore strengths and goals for the term/year ahead.

  • Team Building Challenge Cards - Looking for some fun activities to use to build teamwork skills with your students? These challenge cards are perfect!

  • Teacher Organisation Templates - Use these templates to help organise yourself this school year.

  • Think Before You Speak Posters - These posters can be used as a visual reminder of THINK. i.e. Is it True, Helpful, Inspiring, Necessary and Kind?

  • Editable Meet The Teacher Templates - This simple template will help you to create a 'Meet The Teacher' sheet for the first week of school. This can be sent home to your students' families to share some information about you and the school year ahead.

  • First/Last Day of School Signs - These signs are great for first and last day of school photos! Students and families will be delighted to see the two photos side by side at the end of the school year!

Other resources you may be interested in:

  • Last Week of School Bundle
  • Countdown to Summer Jar Activity
  • Identity Projects Bundle

title: Classroom Library Checklist for Diversity and Inclusion
description:
Diversity, inclusion and representation are so important in your classroom library. Use this class library checklist to complete an inclusion audit of the book available and identify any gaps in your library. The inclusive classroom library checklist explores various aspects of diversity including viewpoints, images, characters, authors etc. A student survey for gathering insights from students is also included in this pack, alongside a four page list of suggested books to help diversify your classroom library.

title: End of Year Letter to Parents From Teacher
description:
Celebrate the end of the school year and express your gratitude to parents with our heartfelt End Of Year Letter to Parents From Teacher. This product includes two carefully crafted letters, tailored for both young and older classes, providing you with the perfect templates to convey your appreciation and reflections with an end of year letter to parents.

Two versions of both letters are included so as to allow you to choose between US and UK spellings e.g. honor/honour.

Key Features of these End of Year Letters from Teacher to Parents:

  1. Personalized Letters: Our warm and friendly letters are designed to help you connect with parents on a deeper level, expressing your gratitude for their support throughout the school year.
  2. Tailored for Different Grade Levels: We understand the importance of age-appropriate communication. That's why we've included two versions of the letter â one for young classes and another for older classes. Choose the letter that best suits your students' grade level, print, sign and you are all set.
  3. Thoughtful and Engaging Tone: Our letters strike the perfect balance between professionalism and a personal touch. They capture the highlights, achievements, and growth of your students, while emphasizing the collaborative efforts between parents and teacher.
  4. Valuable Addition to Your End-of-Year Resources: Enhance your collection of end-of-year materials with these heartfelt letters.

Also, I would really appreciate it if you could leave a review for this product on my store. Your feedback will help me to continue to make helpful resources for you and your students.Â You can also earn TpT credit to use towards future purchases on this website!

title: My Summer Holiday Plans
description:
Looking for a fun activity to wrap up the school year? My Summer Holiday Plans pack is the perfect summer writing prompt resource for you! With 60 pages of templates, your students can share their plans for the summer in a creative and personal way.

This pack includes color and black and white versions of each summer writing template, giving you the flexibility to choose the one that best suits your needs. In addition, the pack offers a range of options to support differentiation within your classroom, including blank, structure, draw and write, wide lined and narrow lined versions. With scaffolded and non-scaffolded versions of the activity, you can tailor the activity to suit the needs of your students.

Whether you use it as an end of year activity, or as a fun way to introduce the topic of summer, this writing prompt will help your students to develop their literacy skills, creativity and self-expression. So why wait? Get your students excited about the summer break and download this versatile and engaging pack today!

If you would like to see some of the other resources that I love using with my students, check out my instagram account at @ciarasclassroom.

title: Student Council Charter
description:
Empower your Student Council (or Student Government) and establish a clear framework for their activities with this comprehensive, editable Student Council Charter. This Microsoft Word document allows you to easily customize and tailor the charter to suit the specific needs and goals of your student council. title: Inclusive Mother's Day Writing and Drawing Activities
description:
Are you looking for an inclusive Mother's Day resource for marking or celebrating Mother's Day with all of the children in your class? Do you have students in your class who might want to celebrate another important lady in their life on Mother's Day? If so, this is the resource for you!

In this pack, you will find portrait drawing sheets and writing templates for an inclusive Mother's Day with your students, offering multiple versions to accommodate and celebrate various family structures and relationships.

I felt it was important to create this resource for my own classroom as not every child has a mom at home or they may have another family member or special woman in their lives that they would like to thank and celebrate.

This resource serves as a powerful tool for creating a warm and inclusive classroom environment on Mother's Day. By acknowledging and honoring diverse family structures, you demonstrate your commitment to ensuring that all students' experiences and backgrounds are respected and valued. Celebrate the love, support, and guidance provided by the special women in your students' lives while reinforcing a sense of belonging and community within your classroom.

Female figures in this resource include:

  • mom
  • mommy
  • mum
  • mother
  • stepmom
  • stepmommy
  • stepmum
  • nana
  • grandma
  • granny
  • grandmother
  • aunt
  • a special lady in my life
  • (and a general one that just uses 'you' and 'she')

Celebrate the unique relationships your students have with the important women in their lives while fostering inclusivity and respect. This resource is perfect for creating a warm and inclusive classroom environment on Mother's Day. Download it now and make this celebration extra special for all your students.

If you would like to see some of the other resources that I love using with my students, check out my instagram account at @ciarasclassroom.

title: While You Were Away Substitute Teacher Feedback Form
description:
I created this substitute teacher form (titled 'While You Were Away') while working as a substitute teacher myself, and I used it on a daily basis. It is a really useful feedback form for a substitute teacher/relief teacher to fill out and leave for the class teacher after subbing in their classroom. The form is clear, quick and easy to fill out and provides the class teacher with an overview of the day, any children who deserve recognition and praise for their exceptional behaviour and kindness, children who needed extra reminders/attention, and a record of attendance. There is also an extra space at the bottom for any additional notes or comments. This is the ideal addition to any substitute teacher's subbing toolkit and a perfect way to leave a great first impression as a substitute/relief teacher!

title: Learning about Islam Resource Bundle
description:
Engage your students in an exploration of Islam as a World Religion with this bundle of teaching resources. Designed to promote research and understanding, the Islam flipbook templates empower students to create their own flipbooks or collaborate with a partner to delve into the key aspects of the Islamic faith. The flipbook features tabs dedicated to essential topics such as muslim symbols, the mosque, the Quran, Ramadan, and Eid.

Our Eid Card Templates are an excellent way to teach students about the cultural significance of Eid, while also engaging their creativity and imagination. With 20 unique designs (10 saying 'Eid Mubarak' and 10 saying 'Happy Eid') to choose from, students can color, decorate, and write their own personal messages for family and friends.

World Hijab Day is celebrated on February 1st each year, and is the perfect opportunity to teach your students a bit about the hijab, the Islamic faith, religious expression and cultural understanding. The three hijab worksheets included in this bundle give your students a space to write about World Hijab Day and decorate a hijab.

The set of graphic organizers and research writing sheets include:

  • Islam KWL Chart: Encourage curiosity and reflection as students document what they know, what they want to know, and what they have learned about Islam.
  • Islam Graphic Organiser: Organize knowledge and insights with this versatile graphic organizer, featuring five headings or topic areas to delve into different aspects of Islam.
  • All About Eid: Explore the traditions and significance of the joyous Islamic festival of Eid.
  • All About Alms: Learn about the concept of giving and charity in Islam and the practice of alms-giving.
  • All About the Mosque: Discover the architecture, rituals, and functions of the Islamic place of worship.
  • All About the Quran: Gain insights into the holy book of Islam, its teachings, and its importance in the lives of Muslims.
  • All About the Hand of Fatima: Explore the symbolism and cultural significance of this hand-shaped amulet in Islamic traditions.
  • All About the Imam: Learn about the role of the Imam, the leader of prayer and spiritual guidance in Islamic communities.
  • All About Misbaha Prayer Beads: Discover the purpose and use of the prayer beads in Islamic devotional practices.
  • All About Traditional Islamic Clothes: Dive into the diversity and cultural significance of clothing in Islamic traditions.
  • All About Muslim Prayer: Explore the rituals, postures, and significance of prayer in Islam.
  • All About Qiblah: Learn about the direction of prayer (Qiblah) and the importance of the Kaaba in Mecca.
  • Symbols of Islam: Identify and explore the important symbols that represent Islam.
  • Similarities and Differences between Islam and _____: Encourage comparative thinking by allowing students to compare Islam with another world religion they are familiar with.

If you would like to see some of the other resources that I love using with my students, check out my instagram account at @ciarasclassroom.

title: Resource BUNDLE for Teaching and Learning About Judaism
description:
Explore the rich history and traditions of Judaism and Jewish people with this comprehensive bundle of resources designed for elementary school classrooms. This bundle includes a range of engaging and informative resources, including a reading comprehension text, writing prompts, vocabulary posters, and more. These resources are designed to be flexible and adaptable, making them perfect for use in a wide range of classroom settings. They could be used as part of a unit on the Jewish faith or as part of the Conceptual Enquiry Approach / Conceptual Inquiry Approach to learning about belief systems around the world.

This Bundle includes:

  • Judaism Comprehension Text with Questions and Answer Key - This pack includes a 3 page text about the history and beliefs of Judaism, as well as a set of comprehension questions to help your students deepen their understanding of the topic. These questions cover a wide range of topics, from the main beliefs of Judaism to key figures in Jewish history, the significance of Jewish holidays and symbols, and much more. Sample answers also included. This comprehensive pack also includes research questions to prompt your students to research and learn even more about the Jewish faith. Sample answers to these questions are also included to support the teacher.

  • Judaism World Religion Flip Book - This flipbook would be perfect for exploring Judaism as a World Religion with your students. Your students can use the templates to create a Flip Book of their own or with a partner about the Jewish faith. This is an engaging and interactive way for your students to research key aspects of the religion and show their learning.

  • Judaism World Religion Written Activity Templates - Your students can use the graphic organizers to guide their research and learning, as well as for writing informational texts based on some important figures, objects and traditions for Jews around the world. There are coloured and black and white versions of each sheet included.

  • Hanukkah Vocabulary Posters - Learn about and celebrate Hanukkah in the classroom with these Hanukkah Vocabulary Posters. These bright and colorful posters make an eye catching word wall or vocabulary display of keywords and matching images. Black and white versions of all posters are included too. The posters include: Hanukkah, candle, gelt, sufganiyot, donuts, dreidel, gift, Israel, latkes, Kiddush cup, chalice, menorah, decorations, torah, and Star of David.

  • Hanukkah Card Templates - Your students can color, decorate and write these Hanukkah cards for their family or friends. The pack includes 20 Hanukkah card templates with two different wordings; 'Happy Hanukkah' and 'Hanukkah Sameach'.

  • Menorah Cut and Paste Activity - Celebrate Hanukkah while working on fine motor skills and cutting skills with this simple menorah cut and paste craft. The menorah cutting and gluing activity comes in both color and black & white.

title: Earth Day Teaching Resources BUNDLE
description:
This Earth Day Bundle is comprehensive pack of teaching materials, including printable activities, reading comprehension with questions and sample answers, and a collection of original Earth Day poems. The bundle is perfect for educators who want to inspire their students to become environmental stewards this Earth Day, while also providing them with fun and educational activities that reinforce important concepts related to sustainability and environmental conservation.

The Earth Day Printable Activities Pack includes a variety of games, coloring pages, and other activities designed to teach students about recycling, renewable energy, and pollution. These activities are suitable for students of all ages and can be used as standalone lessons or as part of a larger unit on environmental science.

The Earth Day Reading Comprehension with Questions and Sample Answers provides a 600-word non-chronological report that explores the significance of Earth Day, while also discussing the importance of taking care of the environment. This pack includes 21 comprehension questions, along with sample answers provided in a convenient table format.

The Earth Day Poems collection features multiple original poems that celebrate the beauty of nature and the importance of protecting our planet. These poems are perfect for use in the classroom or for sharing with students' families and friends. Students could study the poems (free verse, Haiku, Limerick and Acrostic) and then create their own poems inspired by Earth Day and taking care of the environment.

With this bundle, you'll have everything you need to create a memorable and engaging Earth Day lesson plan that your students will love. By using these resources, you'll help your students develop a deeper understanding of environmental science, while also inspiring them to become more mindful of their impact on the planet.

title: Learning about Christianity Resource Bundle
description:
Immerse your students in the study of Christianity as a World Religion with this bundle of teaching resources, including a Christianity flipbook template, graphic organizers, research templates and a Christianity reading comprehension with questions and sample answers.

Designed to facilitate exploration and learning, the flipbook templates empower students to create their own unique Flip Books that delve into various facets of the Christian faith. The religion flipbook templates cover a wide range of topics essential to understanding Christianity. From significant figures to sacred symbols, students can delve into the rich tapestry of the Christian faith. They can explore the concepts of Christian worship, the life of Jesus, the importance of the Bible, and the significance of key Christian celebrations.

The bundle also includes a 3 page information text about the history and beliefs of Christianity, as well as a set of reading comprehension questions and answer key. The Christianity Comprehension Pack also includes research questions to prompt your students in learning even more about the Christian faith. Sample answers to each of these questions are also included for the teacher. Two versions of the text are included in this resource so you can choose the spelling option that works best for you and your students i.e. colour/color, saviour/savior, honour/honor.

The Christianity research/writing templates set includes:

  • Christianity KWL Chart: Encourage students to reflect on their prior knowledge, identify what they want to learn, and record new insights as they explore Christianity.
  • Christianity Graphic Organizer: Organize information and ideas about Christianity using this versatile graphic organizer, featuring five headings or topic areas.
  • All About the Bible: Explore the central text of Christianity, its structure, significance, and key stories.
  • All About Christian Baptism: Discover the sacrament of baptism and its role in Christian initiation and faith.
  • All About the Church Building: Learn about the features and symbols commonly found in Christian churches.
  • All About Holy Mary: Gain insights into the significance of Mary, the mother of Jesus, in Christian beliefs and traditions.
  • All About Jesus: Deepen understanding of the life, teachings, and significance of Jesus Christ in Christianity.
  • All About the Nativity: Explore the story of Jesus' birth and its importance in Christian celebrations.
  • All About Christmas: Discover the traditions, symbols, and customs associated with the Christian holiday of Christmas.
  • All About Mother Teresa: Learn about the life and work of Mother Teresa, a prominent figure in modern Christianity.
  • Symbols of Christianity: Identify and explore the key symbols that hold significance in Christianity.
  • Similarities and Differences between Christianity and _____: Encourage critical thinking by inviting students to compare Christianity with another world religion they are familiar with.

If you would like to see some of the other resources that I love using with my students, check out my instagram account at @ciarasclassroom.

title: Learning about Hinduism Resource Bundle
description:
This Hinduism teaching bundle is an excellent resource for teaching students about Hinduism as a World Religion. Designed to foster a deep understanding of the Hindu Religion, the flipbook and writing templates empower students to embark on a captivating exploration of its core elements. From the majestic Hindu temples to the revered Hindu gods, symbolic representations, and vibrant Hindu celebrations, students will delve into the fascinating world of Hinduism.

The graphic organizers and research writing templates in this bundle include:

  • Hinduism KWL Chart: Encourage curiosity and reflection as students document what they know, what they want to know, and what they have learned about Hinduism.
  • Hinduism Graphic Organiser: Organize knowledge and insights with this versatile graphic organizer, featuring five headings or topic areas to delve into the different aspects of Hinduism.
  • All About Diwali: Explore the significance and traditions of the vibrant festival of lights.
  • All About Holi: Discover the vibrant and joyous festival of colors and its cultural significance.
  • All About Hindu Temples: Learn about the architecture, rituals, and symbolism of Hindu temples.
  • All About Om: Explore the sacred symbol and its spiritual significance in Hinduism.
  • All About Hindu Weddings: Gain insights into the beautiful rituals and traditions of Hindu marriage ceremonies.
  • All About the Ganges: Discover the cultural and spiritual significance of the sacred river Ganges.
  • All About Henna: Learn about the art of henna and its cultural significance in Hindu celebrations.
  • All About the Hindu God Ganesh: Explore the symbolism, mythology, and worship of Lord Ganesh.
  • All About Hindu Traditional Dress: Dive into the colorful and intricate attire worn in Hindu culture.
  • All About Nandi: Discover the significance of the sacred bull Nandi in Hindu mythology and temples.
  • All About Sadhus: Learn about the ascetic holy men of Hinduism and their way of life.
  • Symbols of Hinduism: Explore and identify the important symbols that represent Hinduism.
  • Similarities and Differences between Hinduism and _____: Encourage comparative thinking by allowing students to compare Hinduism with another world religion they are familiar with.

Our Diwali Card Templates are excellent for teaching students about the cultural significance of Diwali, as well as an introduction to Hinduism, Jainism and Sikhism, while also engaging their creativity and imagination. With 12 unique designs to choose from, students can color, decorate, and write their own personal messages for family and friends.

title: Celebrating Women's History Posters Bundle - International Women's Day
description:
Celebrate women's achievements and inspire your students with our 'Inspirational Women Through History Bundle.' The posters are perfect for displaying all year round in your classroom or could be used for International Women's Day or Women's History Month! This comprehensive bundle brings together four remarkable resources that celebrate the accomplishments of influential women across various fields: sports, arts, science, and leadership.

Inspirational Women in Sport Posters: Immerse your students in the stories of trailblazing female athletes with our Inspirational Women in Sport Posters. These visually stunning posters feature remarkable sportswomen who have broken barriers and left a lasting impact on their respective fields. Display these posters in your classroom to inspire and motivate students to pursue their own passions while embracing the value of diversity and inclusivity in sports.

Inspirational Women in the Arts Posters: Ignite creativity and showcase the contributions of remarkable women in the arts with our Inspirational Women in the Arts Posters. From groundbreaking painters to visionary writers, these posters showcase the artistic achievements of influential women throughout history. Use them to foster a deep appreciation for artistic expression, empower students to explore their own creative potential, and foster an inclusive classroom where all voices are celebrated.

Inspirational Women in Science Posters: Spark curiosity and foster a love for science with our Inspirational Women in Science Posters. Highlighting the groundbreaking discoveries of women scientists, these posters provide a powerful visual representation of their achievements. By showcasing these posters, you create a classroom environment that encourages all students to pursue their interests in STEM fields, breaking down gender stereotypes and promoting inclusivity in scientific exploration.

Inspirational Female Figures and Leaders Posters: Inspire future leaders and change-makers with our Inspirational Female Figures and Leaders Posters. From political trailblazers to social activists, these posters celebrate the remarkable achievements of women who have made a lasting impact on society. Display these posters to instill a sense of empowerment, encourage students to find their voices, and cultivate an inclusive classroom that values diverse perspectives and leadership qualities.

Why Choose the 'Empowering Women Through History Bundle'?

  • Foster inclusivity: Each resource in this bundle promotes inclusivity by showcasing the accomplishments of women from diverse backgrounds and fields.
  • Inspire and motivate: The bundle offers a visual celebration of women's achievements, inspiring students to overcome challenges, pursue their dreams, and make a positive impact.
  • Encourage discussion: Each poster serves as a conversation starter, providing an opportunity to explore important topics such as gender equality, representation, and the power of diversity.
  • Enhance classroom environment: Displaying these posters creates a visually engaging and empowering space where students feel seen, heard, and inspired.
  • Versatile and easy to use: The posters are ready to print and display, making them a hassle-free addition to your classroom or learning environment.

title: Inclusive Father's Day Writing and Drawing Activities
description:

title: Gender Equality Resource Pack
description:
This product is a bundle of my Gender Equality teaching resources, and is perfect for teachers looking for an engaging, no prep lesson about gender equality.

  1. The ready-to-go PowerPoint includes 20 gender equality debating prompts for exploring and challenging gender stereotypes with your students. The resource includes instructions for a walking debate (a fantastic style of active learning) during which your students will share their opinions through an oral debate and group discussion. By engaging in the walking debate, your students will broaden their understanding of gender inequality. These prompts could also be used as persuasive writing prompts.
  2. The gender equality writing templates are an engaging and child-friendly way for students to show their understanding of gender equality and/or gender inequality in the classroom and wider world. This resource would be ideal for concluding your exploration of gender stereotypes, equality and children's rights. These print and go worksheets come in 4 different layouts, so that you can choose which level (or writing space) would suit your students and your lesson best. Each of the differentiated worksheets also comes in both colour and printer-friendly black and white options.

If you would like to see some of the other resources that I love using with my students, check out my instagram account at @ciarasclassroom.

title: Elementary School Substitute Teacher Essentials
description:
This bundles includes some helpful resources for substitute teachers, relief teachers and supply teachers.

  • While You Were Away Substitute Feedback Form: I created this substitute teacher form while working as a substitute teacher myself, and I used it on a daily basis. It is a really useful substitute teacher feedback form to be filled out and left for the class teacher after subbing in their classroom. The form is clear, quick and easy to fill out and provides the class teacher with an overview of the day, any children who were exceptionally well behaved, children who needed extra reminders/attention, and a record of attendance. There is also an extra space at the bottom for any additional notes or comments.
  • Circle Time Conversation Starter Cards: This set of conversation starter cards is perfect for facilitating and promoting positive intercultural dialogue in diverse classrooms. I love using these conversation starters with my students and they are definitely one of my favourite resources to use in my multicultural classroom. I find that these open-ended question cards really help my students to build positive relationships and connections with each other.
  • Team Building Challenges: These Team Building Challenges for Students includes a set of 10 challenge cards designed to give your students opportunities to work together and develop their teamwork, communication and collaboration skills. The team building activities are fun and engaging teamwork games for elementary aged students and are ideal for teachers as they require minimal resources (hula hoops, blocks, a marble/ball, sheets of paper).
  • Word Searches: Two sets of differentiated word searches (6 in total) with solutions/answer keys provided for each one.

If you would like to see some of the other resources that I love using with my students, check out my instagram account at @ciarasclassroom.

title: Inclusive Classroom Posters & Multicultural Conversation Cards Bundle
description:
Create an inclusive and engaging learning environment with our Empowering Diversity Bundle! This comprehensive bundle includes two must-have resources designed to promote diversity, foster meaningful conversations, and celebrate multiculturalism in the classroom.

Inclusive Classroom Posters: Transform your classroom into a vibrant and inclusive space with our Inclusive Classroom Posters. This set of beautifully illustrated posters features diverse characters and powerful messages that promote acceptance, respect, and understanding. Perfect for decorating bulletin boards, walls, or creating a dedicated diversity corner, these posters serve as a constant reminder of the value of inclusivity in learning.

Multicultural Conversation Cards: Enhance classroom discussions and promote cultural awareness with our Multicultural Conversation Cards. These thought-provoking cards provide a rich collection of prompts and questions that encourage students to explore different cultures, share personal experiences, and develop empathy. Ideal for group activities, icebreakers, or daily warm-ups, these cards spark meaningful conversations that cultivate a deeper understanding of diversity and promote a positive classroom community.

Why Choose the Empowering Diversity Bundle?

  • Foster inclusivity: Both resources are specifically designed for creating an inclusive classroom where every student feels seen, heard, and valued.
  • Encourage meaningful conversations: The bundle provides a platform for students to engage in dialogue, share perspectives, and embrace diverse cultures.
  • Promote empathy and understanding: The resources help develop empathy and cultural competence, fostering a sense of appreciation for the unique backgrounds of each student.
  • Versatile and easy to use: The posters and conversation cards seamlessly integrate into various teaching strategies, from morning meetings to diversity-focused lessons.
  • High-quality visuals: The eye-catching visuals and engaging content ensure that students stay motivated and interested throughout the learning process.

Unlock the power of diversity and create an inclusive classroom that celebrates the unique strengths of every student. With our Empowering Diversity Bundle, you'll inspire meaningful conversations, cultivate empathy, and promote a positive classroom community. Don't miss out on this valuable resource package!

title: My Special Symbol Project - Exploring Symbols and Cultures
description:
Inspire meaningful discussions on identity, culture, and values with the My Special Symbol Project! This comprehensive resource is designed to engage students in exploring symbols, values, traditions, backgrounds, and cultures around the world. The pack includes a 4-page booklet, three worksheets, a display creation template, and an exploration sheet that introduces the concept of symbols. These materials facilitate meaningful conversations about the significance of symbols and what they represent to individuals and communities.

This social studies resource is an excellent tool for exploring Heritage and Identity, aligning with social studies curricula that emphasize traditions, celebrations, and cultural awareness. It also lends itself well to teaching Ethical Education and Learn Together, encouraging students to reflect on their values and those of others. Furthermore, it aligns with the Conceptual Enquiry Approach, allowing students to delve into symbolism as a core concept within faith groups and belief systems.

If you would like to see some of the other resources that I love using with my students, check out my instagram account at @ciarasclassroom.

title: Teacher Job Application BUNDLE - Teacher Job and Interview Support
description:
Are you a teacher applying for a new teaching job this year? This Teacher Job Application bundle includes my Teacher Interview Workbook and editable teacher CV / teacher resume templates.

The editable teacher resume template will make this quick and simple for you! Simply download, choose your favorite color option (or edit the colors provided) and type into the prompted sections. I have included three color options but these can be edited easily within PowerPoint. Once your Curriculum Vitae is edited and finalised simply print and you are ready to apply to your dream school!

The teaching interview workbook is designed to help you to prepare teacher interview questions and answer based on your own unique skills, talents and experiences. The workbook includes teacher interview questions for elementary and primary school teachers, as well as some helpful tips and considerations to help you plan your answers effectively. This ebook aims to help you to feel confident and well-prepared for your interview, and show why you wold be a great addition to the school team.

This workbook is 70 pages long and includes the following sections:

  1. Introduction
  2. Finding Your Unique Selling Point
  3. Details About the School
  4. Interview Questions
  5. Key Words/Terms
  6. Post-Interview Reflection
  7. Conclusion

title: My Family Project
description:
This 'My Family' project is a 4 page booklet which would be perfect for exploring family diversity, values, traditions and family structures within the classroom. The resource includes a project booklet, two drawing templates and two graphic organiser worksheets which could be used to facilitate conversations about similarities and differences between various types of families and what makes them special. The 'All About My Family' project is left very open so that your students can each choose what they would like to share about their family; making it an engaging and fun project for all.

Your students could complete the booklet in school or as a family project at home. The children could then share their booklets with each other in pairs, groups or as a presentation for the class. This would provide a fantastic opportunity to talk about families of different types, backgrounds, structures and cultures within the class. These booklets could also be added to your classroom library so the children can learn more about each other throughout the year.

This social studies resource works well for exploring Heritage and Identity. It is also ideal for any social studies curriculum that focuses on traditions and celebrations, or for teaching Ethical Education and Learn Together.

If you would like to see some of the other resources that I love using with my students, check out my instagram account at @ciarasclassroom.

title: Judaism Reading Comprehension Passage with Questions and Answer Key
description:
Looking for a reading comprehension text to help your students learn about Judaism? This pack includes a fascinating 3 page informational text about the history and beliefs of Judaism, as well as a set of comprehension questions. The reading comprehension questions cover a wide range of topics, from the main beliefs of Judaism to key figures in Jewish history, the significance of Jewish holidays and symbols, and much more. In addition to the comprehension questions, the information pack also includes sample answers designed to provide a clear and comprehensive explanation of each question, so that your students can gain a deeper understanding of the topic. The Judaism Comprehension Pack also includes research questions to prompt your students in learning even more about the Jewish faith. Sample answers to each of these questions are also included for the teacher.

With this resource pack, you'll have everything you need to help your students learn about Judaism. So why wait? Download our pack today and start exploring the world of Judaism with your students!

title: Peace Collaborative Art - Coloring Project
description:
Explore peace education in your classroom with our Peace Collaborative Art Project. This versatile and engaging resource is not just an art project; it's a gateway to meaningful discussions and a lasting symbol of harmony in your classroom. This Peace collaborative artwork would be perfect for celebrating International Day of Peace and/or embracing the universal theme of harmony as your students contribute to a global message of hope.

Key Features:

  • Classroom Focal Point: The final collaborative poster is more than just a work of art; it becomes a captivating focal point in your classroom. It's a testament to your students' creativity and a reminder of their shared commitment to peace. Display it proudly on your bulletin board, door, or hallway, serving as a daily reminder of the importance of peace.
  • Customizable Options: We understand that every classroom is unique. Therefore, we offer flexibility in this resource. You can choose from two sizing options, a 15-piece or a 28-piece version, to best suit your classroom's needs.
  • No Prep, No Stress: We value teachers' time and have designed this project for ease of use. Simply print, distribute the pieces, and witness your students' creativity and understanding of peace come to life.

Our "Peace Collaborative Art Project" is designed to foster creativity, teamwork, and the spirit of peace in your classroom. By engaging with this project, your students can learn the values of harmony, understanding, and unity. It's not just a holiday activity; it's a bridge to deeper conversations about the importance of peace, both locally and globally.

title: Learning about Buddhism Resource Bundle
description:
Explore Buddhism as a World Religion with this engaging and interactive Buddhism resource bundle. Students research various aspects of the Buddhist faith and then create their own flipbooks or collaborate with a partner to research and showcase their learning about Buddhism. The flipbook templates provide structure, guiding students through the origins, beliefs, practices, symbols, and influential figures of Buddhism. This resource promotes student engagement, research skills, cultural understanding, and fosters discussions on diversity and religious tolerance. Perfect for social studies and project based learning. With this Buddhism resource pack, students can delve into research, expand their knowledge, and develop their writing skills while exploring the figures, objects, and traditions that shape Buddhism worldwide.

The graphic organizers and research writing templates include:

  • Buddhism KWL Chart: Encourage active learning as students document what they know, what they want to know, and what they have learned about Buddhism.
  • Buddhism Graphic Organizer: Organize information and insights with this versatile graphic organizer, featuring five headings or topic areas to delve into different aspects of Buddhism.
  • All About Meditation: Learn about the practice of meditation in Buddhism, its techniques, and its benefits.
  • All About the Buddhist Endless Knot: Explore the symbolism and meaning behind the beautiful and intricate Buddhist symbol.
  • All About the Buddhist Flag: Discover the significance of the colorful flag that represents Buddhism.
  • All About Gautama Buddha: Gain insights into the life, teachings, and enlightenment of Siddhartha Gautama, the founder of Buddhism.
  • All About Mount Kailash: Explore the sacred mountain revered in Buddhism and other religions.
  • All About the Lotus Flower: Discover the symbolism and spiritual significance of the lotus flower in Buddhism.
  • All About Mani Stones: Learn about the inscribed stones found in Buddhist regions and their cultural significance.
  • All About the Dharma Wheel: Explore the symbolism and meaning of the Dharma Wheel, representing the teachings of the Buddha.
  • All About the Enso Circle: Discover the art of the Zen Buddhist circle and its representation of enlightenment and the imperfections of existence.
  • All About Buddhist Temples: Learn about the architecture, rituals, and practices associated with Buddhist temples.
  • Symbols of Buddhism: Identify and explore the important symbols that represent Buddhism.
  • Similarities and Differences between Buddhism and _____: Foster critical thinking by encouraging students to compare Buddhism with another world religion they are familiar with.

If you would like to see some of the other resources that I love using with my students, check out my instagram account at @ciarasclassroom.

title: Christianity Research Templates
description:
Uncover the rich tapestry of Christianity, one of the world's major religions, with this comprehensive resource pack. Designed to enhance religious literacy and foster a deeper understanding of Christianity, this pack offers a diverse range of research sheets and research templates that guide students through research, learning, and informative writing about significant figures, objects, and traditions within the Christian faith.

Engage your students with a variety of resources carefully crafted to facilitate exploration and promote critical thinking. From the Christianity KWL chart and graphic organizer to in-depth topics such as the Bible, Christian Baptism, Church Building, Holy Mary, Jesus, the Nativity, Christmas, Mother Teresa, and more, each sheet and template serves as a valuable tool for classroom discussions and research projects. Encourage comparative analysis by using the "Similarities and Differences between Christianity and _____" sheet, allowing students to connect their knowledge of other world religions.

This resource pack provides both colored and black and white versions of each sheet/template, offering convenience and flexibility. By using this comprehensive Christianity resource pack, educators can create a vibrant and engaging learning environment that nurtures research skills, writing abilities, and critical thinking while fostering a deeper appreciation for Christianity's figures, objects, and traditions.

This Christianity resource pack includes:

  • Christianity KWL Chart: Encourage students to reflect on their prior knowledge, identify what they want to learn, and record new insights as they explore Christianity.
  • Christianity Graphic Organizer: Organize information and ideas about Christianity using this versatile graphic organizer, featuring five headings or topic areas.
  • All About the Bible: Explore the central text of Christianity, its structure, significance, and key stories.
  • All About Christian Baptism: Discover the sacrament of baptism and its role in Christian initiation and faith.
  • All About the Church Building: Learn about the features and symbols commonly found in Christian churches.
  • All About Holy Mary: Gain insights into the significance of Mary, the mother of Jesus, in Christian beliefs and traditions.
  • All About Jesus: Deepen understanding of the life, teachings, and significance of Jesus Christ in Christianity.
  • All About the Nativity: Explore the story of Jesus' birth and its importance in Christian celebrations.
  • All About Christmas: Discover the traditions, symbols, and customs associated with the Christian holiday of Christmas.
  • All About Mother Teresa: Learn about the life and work of Mother Teresa, a prominent figure in modern Christianity.
  • Symbols of Christianity: Identify and explore the key symbols that hold significance in Christianity.
  • Similarities and Differences between Christianity and _____: Encourage critical thinking by inviting students to compare Christianity with another world religion they are familiar with.

title: Buddhism Research Templates
description:
These research templates would be perfect for exploring Buddhism as a World Religion with your students. Each research template is available in both colored and black and white versions, allowing for flexibility and customization. With this Buddhism resource pack, students can delve into research, expand their knowledge, and develop their writing skills while exploring the figures, objects, and traditions that shape Buddhism worldwide.

The Buddhism KWL chart and graphic organizer provide a structured framework for inquiry, while sheets on topics such as Meditation, the Buddhist Endless Knot, Buddhist Flag, Gautama Buddha, Mount Kailash, Lotus Flower, Mani Stones, Dharma Wheel, Enso Circle, Buddhist Temples, and more offer valuable insights into the rich tapestry of Buddhism. Encourage comparative analysis with the "Similarities and Differences between Buddhism and _____" sheet, inviting students to draw connections with other world religions.

Product includes:

  • Buddhism KWL Chart: Encourage active learning as students document what they know, what they want to know, and what they have learned about Buddhism.
  • Buddhism Graphic Organizer: Organize information and insights with this versatile graphic organizer, featuring five headings or topic areas to delve into different aspects of Buddhism.
  • All About Meditation: Learn about the practice of meditation in Buddhism, its techniques, and its benefits.
  • All About the Buddhist Endless Knot: Explore the symbolism and meaning behind the beautiful and intricate Buddhist symbol.
  • All About the Buddhist Flag: Discover the significance of the colorful flag that represents Buddhism.
  • All About Gautama Buddha: Gain insights into the life, teachings, and enlightenment of Siddhartha Gautama, the founder of Buddhism.
  • All About Mount Kailash: Explore the sacred mountain revered in Buddhism and other religions.
  • All About the Lotus Flower: Discover the symbolism and spiritual significance of the lotus flower in Buddhism.
  • All About Mani Stones: Learn about the inscribed stones found in Buddhist regions and their cultural significance.
  • All About the Dharma Wheel: Explore the symbolism and meaning of the Dharma Wheel, representing the teachings of the Buddha.
  • All About the Enso Circle: Discover the art of the Zen Buddhist circle and its representation of enlightenment and the imperfections of existence.
  • All About Buddhist Temples: Learn about the architecture, rituals, and practices associated with Buddhist temples.
  • Symbols of Buddhism: Identify and explore the important symbols that represent Buddhism.
  • Similarities and Differences between Buddhism and _____: Foster critical thinking by encouraging students to compare Buddhism with another world religion they are familiar with.

title: Hinduism Research Templates
description:
Immerse your students in the rich traditions of Hinduism with this comprehensive resource of Hinduism research templates. Designed to explore Hinduism as a World Religion, these sheets and templates will guide your students' research, learning, and informational writing about key figures, objects, and traditions in the Hindu faith.


The product includes a variety of engaging resources to deepen your students' understanding of Hinduism:

  • Hinduism KWL Chart: Encourage curiosity and reflection as students document what they know, what they want to know, and what they have learned about Hinduism.
  • Hinduism Graphic Organiser: Organize knowledge and insights with this versatile graphic organizer, featuring five headings or topic areas to delve into the different aspects of Hinduism.
  • All About Diwali: Explore the significance and traditions of the vibrant festival of lights.
  • All About Holi: Discover the vibrant and joyous festival of colors and its cultural significance.
  • All About Hindu Temples: Learn about the architecture, rituals, and symbolism of Hindu temples.
  • All About Om: Explore the sacred symbol and its spiritual significance in Hinduism.
  • All About Hindu Weddings: Gain insights into the beautiful rituals and traditions of Hindu marriage ceremonies.
  • All About the Ganges: Discover the cultural and spiritual significance of the sacred river Ganges.
  • All About Henna: Learn about the art of henna and its cultural significance in Hindu celebrations.
  • All About the Hindu God Ganesh: Explore the symbolism, mythology, and worship of Lord Ganesh.
  • All About Hindu Traditional Dress: Dive into the colorful and intricate attire worn in Hindu culture.
  • All About Nandi: Discover the significance of the sacred bull Nandi in Hindu mythology and temples.
  • All About Sadhus: Learn about the ascetic holy men of Hinduism and their way of life.
  • Symbols of Hinduism: Explore and identify the important symbols that represent Hinduism.
  • Similarities and Differences between Hinduism and _____: Encourage comparative thinking by allowing students to compare Hinduism with another world religion they are familiar with.

Both colored and black and white versions of each sheet are included, providing flexibility and convenience for your classroom needs.

This comprehensive resource pack will engage your students in a meaningful exploration of Hinduism, promoting cultural understanding and fostering a deeper appreciation for the traditions, beliefs, and values of Hindus around the world.

title: The Philosophers' Bag - Teaching Philosophy for Kids
description:
Interested in teaching philosophy for kids? The Philosophers' Bag is the perfect way to teach philosophy while sparking meaningful discussions and encouraging critical thinking, or even marking World Philosophy Day with your students each November. This Philosophy for Kids pack includes two printable labels/covers that can be attached to a paper bag or gift bag, as well as 44 thought-provoking philosophical questions for kids. Simply print and place inside the bag. A student can put their hand in and pull out a question card for the class to think about and discuss. You could also invite your students to add their own questions to the bag for group discussion. This resource is perfect for any Irish teachers using the Learn Together, or Goodness Me Goodness You Curriculum, both of which include elements of philosophy for kids.

World Philosophy Day is celebrated on the third Thursday of November each year, so mark your calendar and get ready to inspire your students with this exciting 'philosophy for children' activity.
